inclusion.criterion: Girls ≥ 11 years of age and/or who have achieved menarche must have a negative urine pregnancy test.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Genetic and/or biochemical diagnosis of mitochondrial disease.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Eat meals by mouth during the day.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Receive daytime total parenteral nutrition (TPN) and/or continuous enteral feedings.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Prescribed dietary contraindication to mixed meal tolerance testing, e.g., ketogenic diet.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Any investigational drug use within 30 days prior to enrollment.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Persons unable to fast for at least 4 hours.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Persons who may be allergic to the test meals (shakes).
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Parents/guardians or subjects who, in the opinion of the Investigator, may be non-adherent to study schedules or procedures.
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient is a 55-year-old man with Parkinson's disease. He has hypertension and hypercholesterolemia but does not have any signs of dementia.
